assessment, patient history and reassessment) to guide emergency management.

0F1BE550EBEC4EB09A0E075C9BDD4C1A.description:
Apply fundamental depth, foundational breadth of knowledge on the assessment and
management of adequate and inadequate ventilation, including artificial ventilation, minute
ventilation, alveolar ventilation and the effect of artificial ventilation on cardiac output.

B65355C68A954AC59A9ACA27E5CA53DC.description:
Apply fundamental depth, foundational breadth of knowledge on respiration, including the
anatomy of the respiratory system, physiology and pathophysiology of respiration, pulmonary
ventilation, oxygenation, respiration (external, internal, cellular), assessment and
management of adequate and inadequate respiration and supplemental oxygen therapy.

8A28932C99F84E24A42F4C629DF99758.description:
Apply fundamental depth, foundational breadth of knowledge on airway management within
the scope of practice of the Emergency Medical Technician (EMT), including airway anatomy,
airway assessment and techniques of assuring a patent airway.

D08C2F8AD1054B9E9220EB67B6D818A7.description:
Airway: Apply knowledge (fundamental depth, foundational breadth) of general anatomy and
physiology to patient assessment and management in order to assure a patent airway,
adequate mechanical ventilation and respiration for patients of all ages.

FEBC2A73069042F3A202CB6A8CC7C076.description:
Apply fundamental depth, simple breadth of knowledge on emergency medications within the
scope of practice of the EMT, including names, actions, indications, contraindications,
complications, routes of administration, side effects, interactions and dosages for the
medications administered.

10E3BE963E7F469CBA4019C10435F54B.description:
Apply fundamental depth, foundational breadth of knowledge on medication administration
within the scope of practice of the EMT on how to assist/administer medications to a patient.

1775DD2FA677489E9A2295FE96503105.description:
Apply simple depth, simple breadth of knowledge on the principles of pharmacology, including
medication safety and the kinds of medications used during an emergency.

CA313E13383241C3BBE3ED45FEED5F1A.description:
Pharmacology: Apply fundamental knowledge of the medications that the Emergency Medical Technician
(EMT) may assist/administer to a patient during an emergency.

012D8D171FD84DBB87340DE8A0818D3A.description: Use simple knowledge of the principles of illness and injury prevention in emergency care.

FDED6F9E8CE746909ED2EAC26D8D8B22.description:
Public Health: Define and describe knowledge and skills in public health for the Emergency Medical Technician
(EMT).

0EB5D80D65CC45B790F4E5FEEEC17552.description:
Apply fundamental knowledge of life span development to patient assessment and
management.

DEB1B017FF644D12A09FBF3B7E68C49F.description:
Life Span Development: Define and describe knowledge and skills in life span development for the Emergency Medical
Technician (EMT).

CD30FA0AE2134D59BAC5285ADA45F0AF.description:
Apply fundamental knowledge of the pathophysiology of respiration and perfusion to patient
assessment and management.

AF977B625E344E0DBEB0BAE7D12417AE.description:
Pathophysiology: Define and describe knowledge and skills in pathophysiology for the Emergency Medical
Technician (EMT).

8BB1E880C90148E3918647386E16A5DB.description:
Use foundational anatomical and medical terms and abbreviations in written and oral
communication with colleagues and other health care professionals.

97840E7E9D034732901C3E2C8AE10D70.description:
Medical Terminology: Define and describe knowledge and skills in medical terminology for the Emergency Medical
Technician (EMT).

842ED7B2960E41588AD719C3E7C47931.description:
Apply fundamental knowledge of the anatomy and function of all human systems to the
practice of Emergency Medical Services (EMS).

7E1549FDD9C044CCBC0688D524F33066.description:
Anatomy and Physiology: Define and describe knowledge and skills in anatomy and physiology for the Emergency Medical
Technician (EMT).

AD761EBB643449788016AEC9FB6CEFC3.description:
Apply fundamental depth, foundational breadth of knowledge on the consent/refusal of care,
expressed versus implied consent, advance directives, tort and criminal actions, evidence
preservation, statutory responsibilities, mandatory reporting and ethical principles/moral
obligations.

B10F61EAC521475C8C830D8964DF1002.description:
Apply fundamental depth, foundational breadth of knowledge on interviewing techniques,
verbal defusing strategies and family presence issues.

2CFC3C43BE6C46A5A189CC56CEAF721D.description:
Apply simple depth, simple breadth of knowledge on the principles of communicating with
patients in a manner that achieves a positive relationship, including adjusting communication
strategies for age, stage of development, patients with special needs and differing cultures.

1D5DE971895347CBBE41D251211197C5.description:
Apply simple depth, simple breadth of knowledge on EMS communication systems, call for
resources, transfer care of the patient, interaction within the team structure, communication
with other health care professionals and team communication and dynamics.

BA65466FEF8B42D5B5C7B13E046901C3.description:
Apply fundamental depth, foundational breadth of knowledge of documentation on the
principles of medical documentation and report writing.

08325B01F33349B5A1E2B25C5FB4872D.description:
Apply fundamental depth, foundational breadth of knowledge on workforce safety and
wellness, including wellness principles, standard safety precautions, personal protective
equipment, stress management, dealing with death and dying, prevention of work‐related
injuries, lifting and moving patients and disease transmission.

3A0D80CBFD4644C08C105B4654C77FDE.description:
Apply simple depth and breadth of knowledge on data collection and research using evidence‐
based decision‐making skills.

20323327E126496DA8CE15B102EB0B5C.description:
Apply simple depth and foundational breadth of knowledge on EMS systems, including history
of EMS, roles/responsibilities, professionalism of EMS personnel, quality improvement and
patient safety.

7A8F67CB0FC44CA6BECE9B3F259172FC.description:
Preparatory: Apply fundamental knowledge of the Emergency Medical Services (EMS) system, safety/well‐
being of the Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) and medical/legal and ethical issues to the
provision of emergency care.

64E88F88BC8F4F3BAD8D80270AFA506C.description: Obtain certification in basic first aid.

8842C4C8D3FE4BE28312C76536519ADC.description: Identify the duties of a public safety official to provide emergency medical care.

30D1F65274AF44F3A0223F08441CD9AB.description:
Basic First Aid
Demonstrate skills in basic first aid, cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) and use of Automated
External Defibrillation (AED).

D3F4C456ECDE4E4ABD4FE5768A9399C4.description:
Emergency Medical: Learners apply principles of medical care, anatomy and physiology to provide medical
treatment in the field ranging from basic first aid to emergency procedures for traumatic, life‐
threatening injuries. Knowledge and skills may be applied in the fields of law enforcement,
private and corporate security, corrections and Emergency Medical Technician‐B (EMT‐B).

AD1CEB88ED6E4D94BC9F30CA6B0A6352.description: Identify inmates with symptoms of mental health crises and refer to the mental health staff.

C4313BFD3B2C4828B8E81118600AC242.description: De‐escalate crisis situations and intervene per institutional policy.

FF7E60BD0AC5427996DA59366316F18F.description: Identify inmates with greater risk of mental health crises.

632793F31B8C40D39A16229D253AC5ED.description:
Describe how the risk of mental health crisis differs during the beginning, middle and end
phases of incarceration.

5FA0030D3F394F11B465A188DF5ACB72.description: Describe the psychological effects of incarceration on inmates.

30A36EE4E89644DF90F158ED6D60C07E.description:
